isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Crankcase, Crankshaft, Connecting Rods, And Pistons - Connecting Rods, Pistons and Piston Rings - Check Piston Ring End Clearance in Cylinder Bore

svcproc.title: Check Piston Ring End Clearance in Cylinder Bore

figure.caption: Checking the Piston Ring End Clearance in the Cylinder Bore

note.para: Faulty rings cannot always be detected by visual inspection. Therefore, whenever a piston is removed from a cylinder, replace the piston rings.

step1.para: Before installing new piston rings on piston, check gap for each ring as follows:

item.para: Push piston ring down into cylinder bore. Make sure the piston ring is square to the cylinder wall. An inverted piston head can be used to push piston ring to desired location of measurement (usually at the top of the piston stroke).
Use a feeler gauge to measure the gap between the ends of each piston ring.
If the gap does not meet the specification, select another piston ring or check the cylinder bore wear again.
